text: Two monks, Tanzan and Ekido, were traveling together along a road that was barricaded. It was raining all day and all day. At a crossroads, they encountered a beautiful girl, dressed in a kimono and silk belt, unable to wade the road. "Come on, girl", Tanzan said without further ado. And, lifting her up in his arms over the mud, he passed her over. Ekido didn't say a word until, by night, they arrived at the monastery. Then he couldn't take it anymore. "Monkeys like us", he told Tanzan, "should not approach women, especially if they are beautiful young girls. It's dangerous. Why did you do that? "I left it there", Tanzan replied. Are you still wearing it? FIN Anonymous Japanese See the story The furious monk We thank Miguel Díez R. for his contribution to this story to the Ciudad Seva Digital Library.
title: Los dos monjes y la hermosa muchacha
author: nan Anónimo
